Docs.summary: Specifies the style characteristics for the title bars of Web Parts controls within a zone.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TitleStyle> class is used with zones to specify common style characteristics that apply to the title bars of Web Parts controls within the zones. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.PartTitleStyle%2A> property contains a reference to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TitleStyle> object for each zone.
A title bar for a control is rendered at run time as an HTML table cell. Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TitleStyle> class inherits from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle> class, it allows you to set stylistic attributes for a title bar similar to the attributes for any table cell.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the declarative use of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TitleStyle> class. In the code for the following page, an `<asp:calendar>` element and an `<asp:label>` element appear within a zone, giving the corresponding controls genuine Web Parts functionality at run time. Notice that the `<parttitlestyle>` element, which contains several style attributes, applies to the title bars of both Web Parts controls contained within the zone.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TitleStyle> class overrides the base <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle.Wrap%2A> property so that it can set the value to `false`. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TitleStyle.%23ctor%2A> sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TitleStyle.Wrap%2A> property to `false`, so that by default, a title bar for a part control does not allow its contents to wrap.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the declarative use of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TitleStyle.Wrap%2A> property. In the code for the following page, an `<asp:calendar>` element and an `<asp:label>` element appear within a zone, which gives the corresponding controls genuine Web Parts functionality at run time.
Notice that the `<parttitlestyle>` element, which contains several style attributes, applies to the title bars of both Web Parts controls contained within the zone. Notice also that the `<parttitlestyle>` element has `wrap` and `width` attributes. Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TitleStyle.Wrap%2A> property value is set to `true`, and the text in the title bars of the two controls is wider than the value assigned to the `width` attribute, the title bar text of each control wraps when the page is loaded in a browser.
